alert.note: Alert for George; Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 27 at 6:01AM CDT until April 27 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern George County in southeastern Mississippi... Southeastern Stone County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 645 AM CDT. * At 600 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 11 miles east of McHenry, or 15 miles southeast of Wiggins, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern George and southeastern Stone Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
